column7: Introduction to signals and linear systems with examples from biology and medicine. Linear systems and mathematical models of systems, including differential equations, convolution, Laplace transforms, Fourier series and transforms, and discrete representations. Class examples and coursework apply general techniques to problems in biological signal analysis, including circuits, enzyme kinematics, and physiological system analysis. Use of Matlab and Simulink software to understand more complex systems. Prerequisite: CS 101, PHYS 212, and credit or concurrent registration in MATH 285.
column9: Prerequisite: CS 101, PHYS 212, and credit or concurrent registration in MATH 285.
